title: Theatre, charity tea and safari park: The best things to do this week
text:
Theatre, charity tea and safari park: The best things to do this week Theatre, charity tea and safari park: The best things to do this week FROM wildlife and three little pigs to charity teas and fine art, we’ve got your week covered. PUBLISHED: PUBLISHED: 00:01, Sun, Aug 2, 2015 PH Celebrate summer with friends and family by hosting a scrummy Strawberry Tea for charity 
Visit 
Following an £8 million, two-year makeover, York Art Gallery reopened to the public yesterday. The transformed interior includes a spacious gallery of famous works and a new Centre of Ceramic Art with the largest collection of British studio ceramics in the world. 
Works by LS Lowry, Paul Nash, David Hockney and Sarah Lucas are featured. Other displays include a 10,000 handmade ceramic bowls feature by Clare Twomey. 
Call 01904 687687 or see yorkartgallery.org.uk . 
Watch 
Young and old alike will adore the classic tale, The 3 Little Pigs, at London’s Palace Theatre from Wednesday. The new musical by Stiles & Drewe sees stars of pop, the West End and Saturday night TV join forces to tell an alternative tale of the three porkers. 
See the trio leave home, rise to stardom and build their own homes. But will their homes stand firm when the Big Bad Wolf (Simon Webbe) comes to town? 
The musical runs until September 6. Visit 3littlepigslive.com . 
Book 
Wild about animals? Then visit Knowsley Safari Park & Zoo during the school holidays. There are exciting rides and activities for all the family, including driving among lions with the safari team. Don’t miss the Native Bat Night on August 29, when experts will take you on a twilight woodland walk with nocturnal creatures. 
Tickets for Bat Night cost £5. Call 0151 430 9009. Online family tickets to the park cost £55. For more details, see knowsleysafariexperience.co.uk . 
Do 
Celebrate summer with friends and family by hosting a scrummy Strawberry Tea for charity. 
Breast Cancer Care invites you to enjoy tea and treats while raising money to support people affected by the disease. The Strawberry Tea runs throughout August and fruit-filled recipes and ideas are all available online. 
Call 0300 100 4442 or see breastcancercare.org.uk to sign up and receive your free starter kit. Related articles
